description: From Ancient Greek μακρόν (makrón), neuter form of μακρός (makrós, “long”) (English macro-).

entries.meaning: (orthography) A short, straight, horizontal diacritical mark (◌̄) placed over a letter, usually to indicate that the pronunciation of a vowel is long. [from 19th c.]
examples: Coordinate terms: solidus, vinculum, long-vowel mark, overline, overbar, overscore, ◌̅
